adjectives.description: awkward (comparative awkwarder or more awkward, superlative awkwardest or most awkward)

entries.meaning: Lacking dexterity in the use of the hands, or of instruments.
examples: John was awkward at performing the trick. He'll have to practice to improve.
Antonyms: dexterous, gainly, graceful, handy, skillful

entries.meaning: Not easily managed or effected; embarrassing.
examples: That was an extremely awkward moment. Everyone was watching.

entries.meaning: Lacking social skills, or uncomfortable with social interaction.
examples: Things get very awkward whenever 60-year old men use cheesy pick-up lines on me.
These cabinets are going to be very awkward when we move.

adverbs.description: awkward (comparative more awkward, superlative most awkward)

examples: Than groned the knyght for his grymme woundis, and gyrdis to Sir Gawayne and awkewarde hym strykes, and  […]  kut thorow a vayne […].

entries.meaning: Someone or something that is awkward.
